reviews.text: Museum of life of Mahatma Gandhi. This museum gives you the information of Ashram life of Mahatma Gandhi, his intention behind establishing of Ashram and implementation of his principles. It also has some antique documents of time of Mahatma Gandhi. You can have the river front view from here. Very clean and well maintained Ashram. Must visit place for history lovers.

It's a very peaceful place. Serene view besides the river. Someone who loves getting feel of places which have a history would love it. Many foreigners also visit. Couples use this place for having their personal time. Best part is that it is free of cost.

If you want to experience peace in middle of a busy city, this is the place to be. It's like a different world, so calm and peaceful, if you can ignore some usual tourists. No entry fees so you can just go there and can literally spend day sitting under a tree and no one will bother you. There is a small museum with artifacts related to Mahatma Gandhi

If u want to know much about Mahatma Gandhi then its a must visit. Its a very can and well organized place. No body will be disturbing u in the visit. Every one is free to sit or watch as much as time as they want. There r some really good books available hear. Very rare peace of information and paper cuttings, letters can be seen.

The place is located at the heart of the city.It is located on the other side of the Sabarmati Riverfront.
You do not need any entry ticket to visit it.It is free of cost.
This place is a museum about the life of Mahatma Gandhi.There are the presence of artifacts since his birth.
The place is beautiful and well maintained.There is also a bookstore in the premise where you can buy books related to the life of Gandhi and his struggles.
The place time to visit the place in the evening.

Decent place,
With an open air performance stage. 
With decent seats.
It is a quarter-circular space.
Good lighting and good audio environment.

And has a cafe close by too.

Not only a great place for arts, but built by three excellent architects of India. A must place to visit in Ahmedabad. The old addition by Kanvinde.  Second by BV Doshi and  the latest by Indigo architects.
BesT AcAdAmY Dt. 21.09.2018
One of the best place for art and culture activity. I love the interior of institution, its totally historical. Best nakashi work on gate. Time 10am to 10pm
BesT AcAdAmY Dt.21.09.2018

Best of best architecture I've seen in my life because of its unique way to use Brick & only mortar to give Pleasant look in different way. Classroom are best in the seating arrangement and also provide the Electric plug for all individually. All the classroom are with the facility of projector. In all the bathroom tissue & hand wash liquid facility provide which show the quality of institute. Atmosphere is Amazing with its plantation of tree all over the campus. Eagles add the beauty in campus because its continue flying over the campus.

Got a chance to visit IIM today. Prepation of 54th Convocation.
Beautiful decoration. Congratulations to all the students and best of luck for their future endeavour.
It is not just a building in a campus, it's a "poetry in bricks". This place has shaded paved spaces, airy corridors and gardens featuring throughout the site as tool to encourage social interactions
Amazing infrastructure. The vibes that you get only by visiting itself gives you goosebumps imagine being able to study there!!
Without a doubt it's the most beautiful I have visited in India.  Amazed to see a campus can be surrounded and built by all bricks.

Great Collection of Vintage Cars from across the world, spread over a long time period. The cars appear too be well maintained, and I was told that all the vehicles are in running condition, though I really doubt it. The place could be more interactive though as the cars are cordoned off and one cannot see the engines, which is a big minus for engineers and car enthusiasts. Maybe two level of tickets could help, with one getting a chance to be closer to the cars for an extra fee. They run a nice restaurant also.

If You are in Ahmedabad, if you are Vintage Car Lover and love to explore the vehicle the yesteryear people use, You have to give a visit. I am thrilled by seeing the vintage cars, it's models and a dream to own that. ;) You can have a tour in those cars by paying a good amount of money. It's around 1000/person. It's a little far from the city but You can easily get the transport. 
Ticket: 100 + Camera. (2019)
Food and Water Facility Available.
A Toy Park for Children.

I am passionate about cars from my childhood. I am surprised after visited this museum. It has such a amazing collection of cars. I am loving it completely. Here the entry fees of each one is about 100 rupees and please take a photography card worth rupees 100..

I am planning to go there next year also and doing some videos and ride in some cars

Really a good collection  of vintage and classic cars.. but they are not treating them. They deserve more attention than what they getting now.. 

One best thing is that we have an opportunity to travel in any one of the luxury royal car for Rs600($10) for 3KM. 

Entry fee is Rs.100 and camera fee Rs100. 

Worth watching. Do not miss this in your trip if you love cars.....

Two stars for the shear amount of collected cars. However they only have exteriors intact not sure of interiors.
I felt it over priced. Staff is always on hurry to flush you out of premises. They don't allow to walk in reverse direction in case you missed a car to observe.
Like an Army parade you are supposed to walk in forward direction. Unfortunately, if you are one of the customers who visit this museum around closing hours, you would notice that the lights are switched off aggressively as you by pass a car slot.

Jama Masjid in Agra is opposite the Agra fort and overlooking the Agra Fort Railway Station. The Jama Masjid is also popularly known as the Jami Masjid or "Friday Mosque". It is one of the largest mosques in India.

Jama Masjid at Agra also known as 'Friday Mosque' is a seventeenth-century structure and is one of the largest mosques built by the Mughals in India. Constructed under the reign of Shah Jahan in 1648, Jama Masjid is dedicated to his favourite daughter Jahan Ara Begum. This splendid monument is visible from the Agra Fort with the Agra Fort Railway station right between the two structures. Jama Masjid has huge significance in the Indian history and culture and has been intricately designed with multi coloured marbles and sandstone.
This place is ivadat place. Muslim people ivadat here. Very beautiful place.
The detailing done on each part of it is divine to watch & u will feel peace inside it
Nice place ... Visited once. Next going  to Bengaluru. Allah Bless me...
Jhulta minar is behind the railway staion ahamdabad , gujrat,india. This place is not so excited oncurrent time.

Nice archeological place. 
I like this place bcoz of its beauty

Fortunate and can vouch for these shaking minarets, as a child experienceed the same. 
Earlier these used to be quite open and accessible place and in present stage, you have to specifically locate this place. 
As you enter main kalupur station from relief road side, the right turn take you to station while a left side road take towards minarets. As you enter station you first see these minarets but everyone misses them mostly unaware of presence of such rare historic monuments. 
There is a grill gate at front which is locked so you go around to old platform 1 and entry from platform side. There is a temple adjacent to minarets as shown in photos. 
In present state feel satisfied with viewing and relishing the sculpture and wondering how shaking one minaret could shake the adjacent one. It is true and experienced by self.
Enjoy.

The mosque is believed to have been constructed either by Sidi Bashir, a slave of Sultan Ahmed Shah, or by Malik Sarang, a noble in the court of Mahmud Begada, another Sultan of Gujarat. It has been dated to 1452, although the style and material of the minarets point to the close of Mahmud Begada's reign (1511) or later. The body of the building was destroyed in 1753 during the war between the Marathas and the Khan of Gujarat Sultanate; only two minarets and the arched central gateway connecting them remain.

Sidi Bashir Mosque is a former  Masjid  in the city of   Ahmedabad. , Gujarat, India. Only the central gateway and two  minara survive;   they are known as the Jhulta Minar or Shaking Minarets.

The body of the building was destroyed in 1753 during the war between the Marathas and the Khan .only two minara and the arched central gateway connecting them remain.
The mosque is believed to have been constructed either by Sidi Bashir, a slave of Sultan.  Ahrmad shah,.  or by Malik Sarang, a noble in the court of   mahmud begda another Sultan of Gujarat. It has been dated to 1452, although the style and material of the minarets point to the close of Mahmud Begada's reign (1511) or later.

Very well maintained. All the animals, birds, snakes are kept in cage with proper living environment. There are other wild animals like tiger, leopard, elephant, deer, beer, etc. Kept in proper manner with caging. There are two zoo's one is old one and second is new one which is located beside old one. Ticket bought at any of these zoo's is valid for other as well. The new zoo has is smaller compared to old but formar will give good views. It is completely darkened in order to give the best experience to visitors. Most of the animals in old zoo are sleeping. The ticket price is 50 rs for adults and 20 rs for kids.
Looks to be very well managed. All the animals looked nice and and healthy. Only didn't understand why the elephant was tied. Would have been nice to see her roam about.

This is so famous place at Ahmedabad in Gujarat. This is a big zoo and beautiful garden. Also. Here is a pond in this place. Thousands of people visit here everyday. There are many shops in this zoo to serve food for visitors. I love the place so much.

A very well maintained zoo. At first you'll feel amazed by seeing the animals. Then reality strikes as to how we have destroyed their homes. The pain of being caged. I saw more humility in the animals than human beings. Let us all try to save the environment by being a responsible human beings. Kids will really love this place. #zoo

Great Zoo which located into the premises of Kankaria Lake. This includes hundreds of animals such as Tigers, Panthers, Lions, Hippo. Apart from it Crocodile, snakes, turtles, various birds. It would be fun to bring children over here for getting more knowledge in animal life. Recommended to all wildlife lover.

Good one. 
Buddha statues 
Good arrangements of things. 

Specialty : What I found special in this is that they have line drawings of olden times kept for presentation its like half done sketches and its beautiful.

Also called institute of indology, this place is absolutely beautiful with the amalgamation of concrete with nature. Peacocks roam freely here and you get to witness the conservation of ancient Jain manuscripts.

A must see exhibition of Indian drawings curated by Director and veteran art historian Ratan Parimoo. Lovely space designed by Balkrishna Doshi. An oasis of peace in the midst of busy Navrangpura. The next door N.C. Mehta collection within the same campus is also not to be missed.

Superb experience. What an amazing place. So peaceful. Can't believe that this place is on main road but after entering the campus, you feel you are far away from main road.

What a collection of pictures, coins, idols.
Amazing collection of Jain, shaive, Buddhist sculptures.

Got to see few jain tirthankara idols so closely. If you see into the eyes of idols closely  , you will start feeling something different.

Above all, what a collection in library. Two sections in library. One for books and another one for manuscripts. They have 80000+ manuscripts in the library. Some of the books are so rare. 

This institute also invite scholars to speak on various topics.
The exhibition of Indian are amazing.  Don't miss this place if you step by.

Just wonderfully maintained premises. Just loved the creativity i found all around in the premises. Very neat clean and green. Its just awesome. I bet it would be like a dream come true to study here for those who have the "Design" thing in them.

NID is India's leading design institute. It's a beautiful place and you can experience the best campus of any institution. The people are very polite and the work by the students is amazing! Loads of interesting things to see
My alma mater! Still the best school to learn Design in India.
The campus has raw unfurnished rooms . Well equipped.
Best place to study design courses.  Infrastructure also well designed. Faculty is too good.

Such a wonderful place for children and adults. Lovely environment. Good to visit few times. Movie on Sardar Patel is too good must watch that is u r interested in history. 
Have a good parking lot. And don't know about parking tickets. Enjoy a day with family and friends.

A quite interesting museum about Vallabhbhai Jhaverbhai Patel, a politician that fought for the country's freedom and united India.

This place is full of historical evidence and cultural designs. 

The museum is very informative and the information is provided in the most interesting and attractive way.

Everything is presented technologically in most modern style. 

They have a wonderful Light & Sound program in the evening.

There is a 20-25 min video shown about the life of Sardar and how his bold decisions made sure that India remained united.

Very well maintained and designed. Amazing experience.

Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel National Memorial, in an old palace in Ahmedabad, is an honest and praiseworthy effort of Gujarat government to pay tribute to Vallabhbhai Patel who is popularly known as Sardar (Chief, leader.) 
The first deputy prime minister and home minister of India, also known as an iron man, is the founding father of the Republic of India. Through his strong willpower and adroitness, he tactfully guided India's integration into a united nation. India was divided into more than five hundred sixty five princely states. Patel is the one who unified all the states under one umbrella and formed a nation out of hundreds of states.
The museum provides an excellent opportunity to visitors to get an insight into the life and work of India's great son Vallabhbhai Patel.

This is one of best museums to visit. It's usually not crowded and is very well managed. The whole guided tour is brilliantly planned. The interactive multimedia thing is also great. There are some shows held at night. An absolute pleasure to visit this place.

This is one of the best memorials I've visited in India in recent times. It gives very good information about the life of Sardar Patel, his contribution to India's freedom fight and immense work he did to unite the whole India post Independence.There is a 20-25 min AV shown about life of Sardar and how his bold decisions made sure that India remained united. Please don't miss this, it will throw light on how great this man was and how less people know about him and his vision.The artifacts, models and all the information kept here is neatly placed and very informative.

This is a monument that has a mosque, tombs of sufi saints and royalty of the past. A huge, square man made water tank is attached to the monument. When I visited the water tank was empty. The mosque is huge too. Entering the monument, one needs to place shoes in a slotted shelf. A security overlooks the shoes and charges a pittance for securing them. There is a mosque within and it has a architecture melded with Persian, Hindu and Jain influences. The Mosque was bare as it was not prayer time at that moment. From the Mosque one can see the grandeur of the water tank. A famous Sufi Saint's tomb is present too. At the entrance one can purchase roses to lay on the tomb. I went in and prayed for good luck and life. There are many shops and restaurant on the entrance to the monument. The central part of Ahmedabad is not far from here. The area around the monument is being developed and I noticed many apartment complexes coming up. The monument is connected by a modern highway to the airport.

Most of the people you meet here are muslims practicing their faith or relaxing/picnicking in the open court areas. The tomb (first building on the left as you enter the site) is the most beautiful part of the complex. Unfortunately the water reservoir is empty so you lose the perspective of the "peaceful lake" on site. It is well worth a visit and very near to Ahmedabad City.

Sarkhej roza is very beautiful place for photography.
I visited there once there is 2 different locations in that are and once location is not allowed for photography.
Open space when we were there lots of boys also playing cricket so you can also.

Beautiful and peaceful place, a sight that is full with architectural beauties and history. Great place to spend time with family, friends or visit even you are alone. If you are around this place take time to visit this you will love the experience. Also great spot for photographers to cature some beautiful photos.
Peace❤️. One can easily spend 1-2 hours here. Evening is best time to visit.

Beautiful decoration. Congratulations to all the students and best of luck for their future endeavour.

Without a doubt it's the most beautiful I have visited in India.  Amazed to see a campus can be surrounded and built by all bricks.

I visited there once there is 2 different locations in that are and once location is not allowed for photography.
Open space when we were there lots of boys also playing cricket so you can also.

Beautiful and peaceful place, a sight that is full with architectural beauties and history. Great place to spend time with family, friends or visit even you are alone. If you are around this place take time to visit this you will love the experience. Also great spot for photographers to cature some beautiful photos.
Peace❤️. One can easily spend 1-2 hours here. Evening is best time to visit.

Excellent island of knowledge and science. Great for children and families. Good information counter and first aid centre. Nice display on India and its contribution to science and technology. Very spacious and arrangements are good. Staff is very supportive and friendly, they help underaged and senior visitors with great care.
The movie on human evolution seems patchy and seems to be over-shortened.
Dark ride for evolution of seems wanting more in the era data flood and abundant online information.
Science activities and games are of very good variety. Sadly, quite a few games and displays don't work due to lack of maintenance.
Maritime museum is in poor state with poor lighting, smudgy enclosures and very limited display.
Food outlets are not of good quality, few are quite shabby.
Overall good experience, can be improved a lot!

It is Oasis for Kolkata. Though it has lost it's old glory, still it is one of the main attraction of Kolkata in very reasonable price. The garden is well maintained. The newly introduced 3D theater hall is fantastic. However, the old scientific models must be renovated. We also enjoyed the mirrors. They are wonderful.

Very nice place to take children and learn about science. 3D and 2D shows are very good. Evolution of human and Sphere of Earth are very nice. There are lots of things to do and explore. One can easily spend 4-5 hours here.

This is just an awesome place to visit if you are in Kolkata. With family and friends it is a place where you can spend hours of time together. With a beautiful view all around. It has 'Ropeway' to take a better look at this mesmerizing city. There is a maze inside where you can have fun finding your way out. All this and the science fun, aquarium and many more.

It’s a great place to go with your kids. They will get to learn so much from the things available there. Things are basic science and it will make them to take some interest in the subject. Everything is excellent about it. Make your children read about the process which is written there. Reading will help them understand how it works. There’s a show also which takes place for around 20 minutes . Area is huge and takes almost a day to explore it completely.So be ready for a day tour, keep food items and water . Go in the world of science.
